name: Router
comment: Stores a set of route/route-client.UrlPattern to route/route-client.Handler associations and provides methods for calling a handler for a URL path, listening to route/dart-dom-html.Window history events, and creating HTML event handlers that navigate to a URL.

constructors.comment: route/route-client.Router.Router-.useFragment determines whether this Router uses pure paths with route/dart-dom-html.History.pushState or paths + fragments and route/dart-dom-html.Location.assign. The default value is null which then determines the behavior based on route/dart-dom-html.History.supportsState.

addHandler.name: addHandler
addHandler.comment: Registers a function that will be invoked when the router handles a URL that matches route/route-client.Router.addHandler.pattern.

clickHandler.name: clickHandler
clickHandler.comment: Returns an route/dart-dom-html.Event handler suitable for use as a click handler on <a> elements. The handler reverses ur with route/route-client.Router.clickHandler.args and uses window.pushState with route/route-client.Router.clickHandler.title to change the user visible URL without navigating to it. route/dart-dom-html.Event.preventDefault is called to stop the default behavior. Then the handler associated with route/route-client.Router.clickHandler.url is invoked with route/route-client.Router.clickHandler.args.

gotoUrl.name: gotoUrl
gotoUrl.comment:
Navigates the browser to the path produced by route/route-client.Router.gotoUrl.url with route/route-client.Router.gotoUrl.args by calling route/dart-dom-html.History.pushState, then invokes the handler associated with route/route-client.Router.gotoUrl.url.

On older browsers route/dart-dom-html.Location.assign is used instead with the fragment version of the UrlPattern.

handle.name: handle
handle.comment:
Finds a matching route/route-client.UrlPattern added with route/route-client.Router.addHandler, parses the path and invokes the associated callback.

This method does not perform any navigation, go should be used for that. This method is used to invoke a handler after some other code navigates the window, such as route/route-client.Router.listen.

If the UrlPattern contains a fragment (#), the handler is always called with the path version of the URL by converting the # to a /.

listen.name: listen
listen.comment: Listens for window history events and invokes the router. On older browsers the hashChange event is used instead.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides route/route-client.Router.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and route/route-client.Router.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the route/route-client.Router.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
route/route-client.Router.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to route/route-client.Router.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If route/route-client.Router.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of route/route-client.Router.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
